original: Majjhima Nikāya 27
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Cūḷahatthipadopamasutta
analyzed: cūḷa hatthi pada upama sutta
translated: The Shorter Discourse on the Simile of the Elephant’s Footprint

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.🔽Tena kho pana samayena jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo sabbasetena vaḷavābhirathena sāvatthiyā niyyāti divādivassa.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme  tena kho pana samayena jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ sabba setena vaḷava abhirathena sāvatthiyā niyyāti divā divassa
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park. 🔽Now on that occasion the brahmin Jānussoṇi was driving out of Sāvatthī in the middle of the day in an all-white chariot drawn by white mares.

original: Addasā kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo pilotikaṁ paribbājakaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.🔽Disvāna pilotikaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: addasā kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ pilotikam paribbājakam dūratas vā āgacchanta  disvāna pilotikam paribbājakam etat avoca
translated: He saw the wanderer Pilotika coming in the distance

original: “Handa kuto nu bhavaṁ vacchāyano āgacchati divādivassā”ti?
analyzed: handa kutas nu bhavam vacchāyanaḥ āgacchati
translated: and said to him, “Well now, where is Master Vacchāyana coming from in the middle of the day?”

original: “Ito hi kho ahaṁ, bho, āgacchāmi samaṇassa gotamassa santikā”ti.🔽“Taṁ kiṁ maññati bhavaṁ vacchāyano samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyaṁ paṇḍito maññe”ti.
analyzed: itas hi kho aha bho āgacchāmi samaṇassa gotamassa santikā ati  tam kim maññati bhavam vacchāyanaḥ samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyam paṇḍitaḥ maññeti
translated: “I’m coming from the presence of the recluse Gotama, sir.”🔽“What do you think of the recluse Gotama’s lucidity of wisdom? He seems to be wise.”

original: “Ko cāhaṁ, bho, ko ca samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyaṁ jānissāmi.
analyzed: kaḥ ca āha bho kaḥ ca samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyam jānissāmi
translated: “Sir, who am I to know the recluse Gotama’s lucidity of wisdom?

original: Sopi nūnassa tādisova yo samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyaṁ jāneyyā”ti.
analyzed: saḥ api nūna ssa tādisaḥ uva yaḥ samaṇassa gotamassa jāneyya ati
translated: Whoever knows the extent of the recluse Gotama’s wisdom would know the extent of the ocean with his hand.

original: “Uḷārāya khalu bhavaṁ vacchāyano samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ pasaṁsāya pasaṁsatī”ti.
analyzed: uḷārāya khalu bhavam vacchāyanaḥ samaṇam gotamam pasasāya pasasati iti
translated: “Master Vacchayana praises the recluse Gotama with high praise indeed.”

original: “Ko cāhaṁ, bho, ko ca samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ pasaṁsissāmi,
analyzed: kaḥ ca āha bho kaḥ ca samaṇam gotamam pasasissāmi
translated: “What am I, sir, to do with my praise of the recluse Gotama?

original: pasatthapasatthova so bhavaṁ gotamo seṭṭho devamanussānan”ti.
analyzed: pasattha pasatthaḥ uva saḥ bhavam gotamo seṭṭhaḥ deva manussānam ti
translated: The Blessed One is praised by the praised as best among gods and humans.”

original: “Kaṁ pana bhavaṁ vacchāyano atthavasaṁ sampassamāno samaṇe gotame evaṁ abhippasanno”ti?🔽“Seyyathāpi, bho, kusalo nāgavaniko nāgavanaṁ paviseyya.
analyzed: kam pana bhavam vacchāyanaḥ atthavasam sampassamāno samaṇe gotame evam abhippasanno ti  seyyathā api bho kusalaḥ nāga vanikaḥ nāga vanam paviseyya
translated: “But, master Vacchayana, what quality do you see in the recluse Gotama because of which you are so devoted to him?”

original: So passeyya nāgavane mahantaṁ hatthipadaṁ, dīghato ca āyataṁ, tiriyañca vitthataṁ.
analyzed: so passeyya nāgavane mahantam hatthi pada dīghatas ca tiriyañca
translated: “Suppose, sir, a skilled elephant hunter were to enter an elephant wood and were to see in the elephant wood a big elephant’s footprint, long in extent and broad across.

original: So niṭṭhaṁ gaccheyya:
analyzed: saḥ niṭṭham gaccheyya
translated: He would come to the conclusion:

original: ‘mahā vata bho nāgo’ti.
analyzed: mahā vata bho nāga uti
translated: ‘Indeed, this is a big bull elephant.’

original: Evameva kho ahaṁ, bho, yato addasaṁ samaṇe gotame cattāri padāni athāhaṁ niṭṭhamagamaṁ:
analyzed: evam eva kho aha bho yatas addasam samaṇe gotame cattāri padāni atha aham niṭṭham agama
translated: So too, sir, when I saw four footprints of the recluse Gotama, then I came to the conclusion:

original: ‘sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho’ti.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammo su paṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ iti
translated: ‘The Lord is a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, a Well-Farer, knower of the world, incomparable trainer of men to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, the Lord Buddha. The Dhamma is well-proclaimed by the Lord, it is visible, not subject to time, inviting inspection, onward-leading, and can be understood by the wise for themselves.’

original: Katamāni cattāri?
analyzed: katamāni cattāri
translated: What are the four?

original: Idhāhaṁ, bho, passāmi ekacce khattiyapaṇḍite nipuṇe kataparappavāde vālavedhirūpe, te bhindantā maññe caranti paññāgatena diṭṭhigatāni.
analyzed: idha āha bho passāmi ekacce khattiya paṇḍite nipuṇe kata para ppavāde vāla vedhi rūpe te bhindantā maññe caranti paññāgatena diṭṭhi gatāni
translated: Here I see some nobles who are wise, skilled, and clever, who have made an effort to learn, and who are critical of wrong and right.

original: Te suṇanti:
analyzed: te suṇanti
translated: They hear:

original: ‘samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo amukaṁ nāma gāmaṁ vā nigamaṁ vā osarissatī’ti.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ amukam nāma gāmam vā nigamam vā osarissati iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama will come down to such and such a village or town.’

original: Te pañhaṁ abhisaṅkharonti:
analyzed: te pañham abhisaṅkharonti
translated: They formulate a question:

original: ‘imaṁ mayaṁ pañhaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ upasaṅkamitvā pucchissāma.🔽Evañce no puṭṭho evaṁ byākarissati, evamassa mayaṁ vādaṁ āropessāma.
analyzed: imam mayam pañham samaṇam gotamam upasaṅkamitvā pucchissāma  evam ce no puṭṭhaḥ evam byākarissati evam assa mayam vādam āropessāma
translated: ‘We will go to the ascetic Gotama and ask him this question.🔽If he is asked like this, he will answer like this.

original: Evañcepi no puṭṭho evaṁ byākarissati, evampissa mayaṁ vādaṁ āropessāmā’ti.
analyzed: evam ce pi no puṭṭhaḥ evam byākarissati evam pissa mayam vādam āropessāma ati
translated: If he is asked like this, he will answer like that.’

original: Te suṇanti:
analyzed: te suṇanti
translated: They hear:

original: ‘samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo amukaṁ nāma gāmaṁ vā nigamaṁ vā osaṭo’ti.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ amukam nāma gāmam vā nigamam vā osaṭaḥ iti
translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama has come down to such and such a village or town.’

original: Te yena samaṇo gotamo tenupasaṅkamanti.
analyzed: te yena samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tena upasaṅkamanti
translated: They go to the ascetic Gotama.

original: Te samaṇo gotamo dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṁseti.
analyzed: te samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaseti
translated: The ascetic Gotama instructs, rouses, enthuses, and delights them with a Dhamma talk.

original: Te samaṇena gotamena dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṁsitā na ceva samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ pañhaṁ pucchanti, kutossa vādaṁ āropessanti?
analyzed: te samaṇena gotamena dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahasitā na ca iva samaṇam gotamam pañham pucchanti kutas sa vādam āropessanti
translated: Having been instructed, roused, enthused, and delighted by the ascetic Gotama with a Dhamma talk, they don’t even ask him a question, let alone refute his assertions.

original: Aññadatthu samaṇasseva gotamassa sāvakā sampajjanti.
analyzed: aññadatthu samaṇassa iva gotamassa sāvakā sampajjanti
translated: Instead, they become his disciples.

analyzed: yat āha bho samaṇe gotame imam paṭhamam padam addasam atha aham niṭṭham agama
translated: When I saw this first quality in the ascetic Gotama, I came to the conclusion:🔽‘The Blessed One is a Worthy One, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha,

original: ‘sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho’ti.🔽Puna caparāhaṁ, bho, passāmi idhekacce brāhmaṇapaṇḍite …pe…🔽gahapatipaṇḍite …
analyzed: sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammo su paṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ iti  puna ca parāha bho passāmi idha ekacce brāhmaṇa paṇḍite pe  gahapati paṇḍite
translated: perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Well-Farer, a knower of the cosmos, an unexcelled trainer of those persons ready to be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.’🔽Furthermore, I see that some brahmin scholars …🔽some gentleman scholars …

original: pe…
analyzed: pe
translated: some ascetic scholars …

analyzed: samaṇa paṇḍite nipuṇe kata para ppavāde vāla vedhi rūpe te bhindantā maññe caranti paññāgatena diṭṭhi gatāni
translated: are clever, skilled, and practiced in what they say, and they seem to be splitting hairs with their insight and views.

original: Te suṇanti:
analyzed: te suṇanti
translated: They hear:

translated: ‘The ascetic Gotama is coming to such-and-such a village or town.’

analyzed: te pañham abhisaṅkharonti imam mayam pañham samaṇam gotamam upasaṅkamitvā pucchissāma

translated: If he is asked like this, he will answer like this, and we will refute his answer like this.’

analyzed: te suṇanti samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ amukam nāma gāmam vā nigamam vā
translated: They hear that ‘The ascetic Gotama has arrived in such-and-such a village or town.’

analyzed: te yena samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tena upasaṅkamanti

analyzed: te samaṇena gotamena dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahasitā na ca iva samaṇam gotamam pañham pucchanti kutas sa vādam āropessanti
translated: Having been instructed, urged, roused, and encouraged by the ascetic Gotama with a talk on the Teaching, they don’t even ask him the question, let alone refute his answer.

original: Aññadatthu samaṇaṁyeva gotamaṁ okāsaṁ yācanti agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajjāya.
analyzed: aññadatthu samaṇayā iva gotamam okāsam yācanti agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajjāya
translated: They ask the ascetic Gotama for permission to go forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: Te samaṇo gotamo pabbājeti.
analyzed: te samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ pabbājeti
translated: The ascetic Gotama gives them the going forth.

original: Te tattha pabbajitā samānā vūpakaṭṭhā appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharantā nacirasseva—yassatthāya🔽kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ
analyzed: te tattha pabbajitā samānāḥ vūpakaṭṭhāḥ appamattāḥ ātāpinaḥ pahita ttāḥ viharantā  kula puttā sammad eva agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajanti tad anuttara brahmacariya pariyosāna
translated: Having gone forth, they live as withdrawn as a turtle in its shell, ardent, keen, and resolute.🔽Before long,🔽they realize with their own insight that unsurpassed consummation of the spiritual life for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the home life into homelessness,

original: diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharanti.
analyzed: diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharanti
translated: and they dwell in it.

original: Te evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: te
translated: They say:

original: ‘manaṁ vata, bho, anassāma, manaṁ vata, bho, panassāma;
analyzed: manam vata bho anassāma manam vata bho panassāma
translated: ‘We have won, sirs, we have won!

original: mayañhi pubbe assamaṇāva samānā samaṇamhāti paṭijānimha, abrāhmaṇāva samānā brāhmaṇamhāti paṭijānimha, anarahantova samānā arahantamhāti paṭijānimha.
analyzed: mayan hi pubbe assamaṇā ava samānā samaṇamhā ati paṭijānimha abrāhmaṇā ava samānā brāhmaṇamhā ati paṭijānimha an arahantaḥ uva samānāḥ arahantamhā ati paṭijānimha
translated: For previously we claimed to be ascetics though we were not really ascetics, we claimed to be brahmins though we were not really brahmins, we claimed to be arahats though we were not really arahats.

original: Idāni khomha samaṇā, idāni khomha brāhmaṇā, idāni khomha arahanto’ti.
analyzed: idāni khomha samaṇāḥ idāni khomha brāhmaṇāḥ idāni khomha arahantaḥ iti
translated: But now we are ascetics, now we are brahmins, now we are arahats!’

original: Yadāhaṁ, bho, samaṇe gotame imaṁ catutthaṁ padaṁ addasaṁ athāhaṁ niṭṭhamagamaṁ:
analyzed: yat āha bho samaṇe gotame imam catuttham padam addasam atha aham niṭṭham agama
translated: When I saw this fourth quality in him, I came to the conclusion:

original: ‘sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho’ti.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammo su paṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ iti
translated: ‘The Blessed One is fully enlightened, perfected in knowledge and conduct, a Well-Farer, Knower of the worlds, incomparable Trainer of men to be tamed, Teacher of gods and humans, the Enlightened One, the Blessed One. His Dhamma is well-proclaimed, well-expounded, and makes for going beyond. It is to be seen here and now, timeless, inviting inspection, leading onward, to be realized individually by the wise.

original: Yato kho ahaṁ, bho, samaṇe gotame imāni cattāri padāni addasaṁ athāhaṁ niṭṭhamagamaṁ:
analyzed: yatas kho aha bho samaṇe gotame imāni cattāri padāni addasam atha aham niṭṭham agama
translated: When I saw these four qualities in him, I came to the conclusion:

original: ‘sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho’”ti.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammo su paṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ iti
translated: “The Blessed One is fully enlightened, perfected in knowledge and conduct, a Well-Farer, Knower of the worlds, incomparable Trainer of men to be tamed, Teacher of gods and humans, the Enlightened One, the Blessed One. His Dhamma is well-proclaimed, well-expounded, and makes for going beyond. It is to be seen here and now, timeless, inviting inspection, leading onward, to be realized individually by the wise.”’

original: Evaṁ vutte, jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo sabbasetā vaḷavābhirathā orohitvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
analyzed: evam vutte jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ sabba setā vaḷava abhirathā orohitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā tikkhattum udānam udānesi
translated: When this was said, the brahmin Janussoni descended from the chariot, and arranging his upper robe on one shoulder, he extended his hands in reverential salutation towards the Blessed One and uttered this exclamation three times:

original: “Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa;🔽namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa;
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa  namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: “Homage to the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened!🔽Homage to the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened!

original: namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassāti.
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa ati
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened!”

original: Appeva nāma mayampi kadāci karahaci tena bhotā gotamena saddhiṁ samāgaccheyyāma, appeva nāma siyā kocideva kathāsallāpo”ti.
analyzed: appā iva nāma mayam pi kadāci karahaci tena bhotā gotamena saddhim samāgaccheyyāma appā iva nāma siyā kocid eva kathā sallāpā uti
translated: Perhaps we might meet the Lord Gotama at some time or other, and have some conversation with him.”

original: Atha kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the brahmin Janussoni went to the Lord, and exchanged courtesies with him,

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo yāvatako ahosi pilotikena paribbājakena saddhiṁ kathāsallāpo taṁ sabbaṁ bhagavato ārocesi.
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi  ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ yāvatakaḥ ahosi pilotikena paribbājakena saddhim kathā sallāpaḥ tam sabbam bhagavataḥ ārocesi
translated: and after a polite conversation he sat down to one side.🔽And he told the Lord all that had happened in his conversation with the wanderer Pilotika.

original: Evaṁ vutte, bhagavā jāṇussoṇiṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte bhagavā jāṇussoṇim brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: When he had finished, the Lord said:

original: “na kho, brāhmaṇa, ettāvatā hatthipadopamo vitthārena paripūro hoti.
analyzed: na kho brāhmaṇaḥ ettāvatā hatthi pada upamaḥ vitthārena paripūraḥ hoti
translated: “Brahmin, the simile of the elephant’s footprint has not yet been completed in detail.

original: Api ca, brāhmaṇa, yathā hatthipadopamo vitthārena paripūro hoti
analyzed: api ca brāhmaṇa yathā hatthi pada upamaḥ vitthārena paripūraḥ hoti
translated: But, brahmin, I will teach you the complete simile of the elephant’s footprint in detail.

original: taṁ suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: Listen, and pay careful attention to what I shall say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo bhagavato paccassosi.

translated: He comes to the conclusion:

translated: ‘That is the great elephant.’🔽“So too, brahmin, a Tathagata appears in the world, accomplished, fully enlightened …

original: So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.

translated: He reveals this world—with its devas, Mara, and Brahma, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its devas and humans—having realized it by his own superknowledge.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ; kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjana kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, and he reveals a holy life that is utterly perfect and pure.

original: Taṁ dhammaṁ suṇāti gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aññatarasmiṁ vā kule paccājāto.
analyzed: tam dhammam suṇāti gahapati vā gahapati putto vā aññatarasmim vā kule paccājātaḥ
translated: A householder or householder’s son or one born in some other clan hears that Dhamma.

original: So taṁ dhammaṁ sutvā tathāgate saddhaṁ paṭilabhati.
analyzed: saḥ tam dhammam sutvā tathāgate saddham paṭilabhati
translated: Having heard that Dhamma, he acquires faith in the Tathāgata.

original: So tena saddhāpaṭilābhena samannāgato iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ tena saddhā paṭilābhena samannāgataḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: Endowed with that faith, he considers thus:

original: ‘sambādho gharāvāso rajopatho, abbhokāso pabbajjā.🔽Nayidaṁ sukaraṁ agāraṁ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṁ ekantaparisuddhaṁ saṅkhalikhitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ.
analyzed: sambādhaḥ gharāvāsaḥ rajopathaḥ abbhokāsaḥ pabbajjā  na idam sukaram agāram ajjhāvasatā ekanta paripuṇṇam ekanta parisuddham saṅkha likhitam brahmacariyam caritu
translated: ‘Household life is crowded and dusty; life gone forth is wide open.🔽It is not easy, while living in a home, to lead the holy life utterly perfect and pure as a polished shell.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajeyyanti
translated: Suppose I shave off my hair and beard, put on the yellow robe, and go forth from the home life into homelessness.’

original: So aparena samayena appaṁ vā bhogakkhandhaṁ pahāya mahantaṁ vā bhogakkhandhaṁ pahāya🔽appaṁ vā ñātiparivaṭṭaṁ pahāya mahantaṁ vā ñātiparivaṭṭaṁ pahāya kesamassuṁ ohāretvā
analyzed: so aparena samayena appam vā bhogakkhandham pahāya mahantam vā bhogakkhandham pahāya  appam vā ñāti parivaṭṭam pahāya mahantam vā ñāti parivaṭṭam pahāya kesa massuṃ ohāretvā
translated: “Then, after some time, having abandoned a small or a large fortune,

original: kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
analyzed: kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajati
translated: having abandoned a small or a large circle of relations, he shaves off his hair and beard, puts on the yellow robe, and goes forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: So evaṁ pabbajito samāno bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā
analyzed: so evam pabbajitaḥ samānaḥ bhikkhūnam sikkhā sājīva samāpannaḥ pāṇātipātam pahāya pāṇātipātā
translated: Having thus gone forth and possessing the bhikkhus’ training and way of life, he abandons taking what is not given and abstains from taking what is not given;

original: paṭivirato hoti, nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.🔽Adinnādānaṁ pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti dinnādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī. Athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharati.
analyzed: paṭivirataḥ hoti nihita daṇḍaḥ nihita satthaḥ lajjī dayā āpanno sabba pāṇa bhūta hita anukampī viharati  a dinna ādānam pahāya a dinna ādānā paṭivirataḥ hoti dinna ādāyī dinna pāṭikaṅkhī atha enena sucibhūtena attanā viharati
translated: he dwells compassionate to all living beings.🔽Having given up taking what is not given, he abstains from taking what is not given. He does not take by way of theft the wealth and property of others in the village or in the wilderness.

original: Abrahmacariyaṁ pahāya brahmacārī hoti ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.🔽Musāvādaṁ pahāya musāvādā paṭivirato hoti saccavādī saccasandho theto paccayiko avisaṁvādako lokassa.🔽Pisuṇaṁ vācaṁ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, ito sutvā na amutra akkhātā🔽imesaṁ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā na imesaṁ akkhātā amūsaṁ bhedāya. Iti bhinnānaṁ vā
analyzed: a brahmacariyam pahāya brahmacārī hoti ārā cārī virataḥ methunā gāma dhammā  musāvādam pahāya musāvādā paṭivirataḥ hoti sacca vādī sacca sandho theto paccayikaḥ a visavādakaḥ lokassa  pisuṇam vācam pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirataḥ hoti itas sutvā na amutra akkhātā  imesam bhedāya amutra vā sutvā na imesam akkhātāḥ amūsam bhedāya iti bhinnānam vā
translated: Having given up unchastity, he observes chastity. He lives without sensual desire, far from sensual desire, with a mind that is unattached to sensual desire.🔽Having given up false speech, he abstains from false speech. He is a truth-speaker, one who is trustworthy and reliable, and an advisor to many.

original: sandhātā sahitānaṁ vā anuppadātā, samaggārāmo samaggarato samagganandī samaggakaraṇiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti.
analyzed: sandhātā sahitānam vai anuppadātā samagga ārāmaḥ samagga rataḥ samagga nandī samagga karaṇim vācam bhāsitā hoti
translated: Having given up malicious speech, he abstains from malicious speech. What he has heard here he does not tell there to break those people apart from these people here. What he has heard there he does not tell here to break these people apart from those people there. Thus reconciling those who have broken apart or cementing those who are united, he loves concord, delights in concord, enjoys concord, speaks things that create concord.

original: Pharusaṁ vācaṁ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti. Yā sā vācā nelā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅgamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā hoti.
analyzed: pharusam vācam pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirataḥ hoti yā sā vācā nelā kaṇṇa sukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅgamā porī bahu jana kantā bahu jana manāpā tathārūpim vācam bhāsitā hoti
translated: He gives up harsh speech and abstains from it. He speaks only such words as are gentle, pleasing to the ear, endearing, going to the heart, urbane, amiable, and agreeable to the many-folk.🔽He gives up idle chatter and abstains from it. He speaks in season, speaks what is factual, what is in accordance with the goal, the Dhamma, and the Vinaya. He speaks words worth treasuring, seasonable, reasonable, circumscribed, and endowed with meaning.

original: Samphappalāpaṁ pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī, nidhānavatiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā kālena sāpadesaṁ pariyantavatiṁ atthasaṁhitaṁ.🔽So bījagāmabhūtagāmasamārambhā paṭivirato hoti,
analyzed: samphappalāpam pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirataḥ hoti kāla vādī bhūta vādī attha vādī dhamma vādī vinaya vādī nidhānavatim vācam bhāsitā kālena sa apadesam pariyantavatim attha sahita  saḥ bīja gāma bhūta gāma samārambhā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: He abstains from injuring seeds and plants.

original: ekabhattiko hoti rattūparato, virato vikālabhojanā,🔽naccagītavāditavisūkadassanā paṭivirato hoti,
analyzed: eka bhattikaḥ hoti rattu uparataḥ virataḥ vikāla bhojanā  nacca gīta vādita visūka dassanā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: He eats only in one part of the day, refraining from food at night and from eating at the wrong time.🔽He abstains from dancing, singing, instrumental music, and witnessing unsuitable shows.

original: mālāgandhavilepanadhāraṇamaṇḍanavibhūsanaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti,
analyzed: mālā gandha vilepana dhāraṇa maṇḍana vibhūsana ṭṭhānā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: He abstains from wearing garlands, embellishing himself with scents, and beautifying himself with cosmetics.🔽He abstains from accepting gold, silver, pearls, gems, corals, crystals, and other precious stones.

original: uccāsayanamahāsayanā paṭivirato hoti,🔽jātarūparajatapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti,🔽āmakadhaññapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti,
analyzed: uccāsayana mahāsayanā paṭivirataḥ hoti 🔽jātarūpa rajata paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti 🔽āmaka dhañña paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: He abstains from accepting women and girls,

original: āmakamaṁsapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti,🔽itthikumārikapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti,
analyzed: āmaka masa paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti  itthi kumārika paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: He doesn’t accept raw grain,🔽women and girls,

original: dāsidāsapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti,🔽ajeḷakapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti,🔽kukkuṭasūkarapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti,
analyzed: dāsi dāsa paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti  ajeḷaka paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti  kukkuṭa sūkara paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: male and female slaves,🔽goats and sheep,🔽chickens and pigs,

original: hatthigavāssavaḷavapaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti,
analyzed: hatthi gavāssa vaḷava paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: elephants, cattle, horses, and mares,

original: khettavatthupaṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti,
analyzed: khetta vatthu paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: fields and plots,

original: dūteyyapahiṇagamanānuyogā paṭivirato hoti,🔽kayavikkayā paṭivirato hoti,🔽tulākūṭakaṁsakūṭamānakūṭā paṭivirato hoti,
analyzed: dūteyya pahiṇa gamana anuyogā paṭivirataḥ hoti  kaya vikkayā paṭivirataḥ hoti  tulā kūṭaka sa kūṭa māna kūṭā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: and he doesn’t act as an intermediary for others in buying and selling.🔽He doesn’t deal in gold and silver,🔽he doesn’t use a scale or measure to cheat,

original: ukkoṭanavañcananikatisāciyogā paṭivirato hoti,
analyzed: ukkoṭana vañcana nikati sāci yogā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: he doesn’t cheat with sieves or in currency,

original: chedanavadhabandhanaviparāmosaālopasahasākārā paṭivirato hoti.
analyzed: chedana vadha bandhana viparāmosa ālopa sahasākārā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: he doesn’t destroy living beings, he doesn’t incite others to do so, and he doesn’t approve of such actions.

original: So santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena. So yena yeneva pakkamati samādāyeva pakkamati.
analyzed: saḥ santuṭṭhaḥ hoti kāya parihārikena cīvarena kucchi parihārikena piṇḍapātena so yena yena iva pakkamati samādāya iva pakkamati
translated: He is content with robes to look after the body and almsfood to look after the belly. Wherever he goes, he sets out taking only these things.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma pakkhī sakuṇo yena yeneva ḍeti sapattabhārova ḍeti;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma pakkhī sakuṇaḥ yena yena iva ḍeti sa patta bhāraḥ uva ḍeti
translated: Just as a bird, wherever it goes, flies with its wings as its only burden,

original: evameva bhikkhu santuṭṭho hoti kāyaparihārikena cīvarena kucchiparihārikena piṇḍapātena. So yena yeneva pakkamati samādāyeva pakkamati.
analyzed: evam eva bhikkhu santuṭṭhaḥ hoti kāya parihārikena cīvarena kucchi parihārikena piṇḍapātena so yena yena iva pakkamati samādāya iva pakkamati
translated: so too is the monk content with robes to protect his body and almsfood to sustain his belly, and he goes forth taking only these.

original: So iminā ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato ajjhattaṁ anavajjasukhaṁ paṭisaṁvedeti.
analyzed: saḥ iminā ariyena sīla kkhandhena samannāgataḥ ajjhattam anavajja sukham paṭisavedeti
translated: Endowed with this aggregate of noble virtue, he experiences within himself a bliss that is blameless.

original: So cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā na nimittaggāhī hoti nānubyañjanaggāhī.🔽Yatvādhikaraṇamenaṁ cakkhundriyaṁ asaṁvutaṁ viharantaṁ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā
analyzed: so cakkhunā rūpam disvā na nimitta ggāhī hoti na anubyañjana ggāhī  yatvā adhikaraṇam enam cakkhu indriyam asavutam viharantam abhijjhā domanassā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ
translated: On seeing a form with the eye, he does not grasp at its signs and features.

original: dhammā anvāssaveyyuṁ tassa saṁvarāya paṭipajjati, rakkhati cakkhundriyaṁ, cakkhundriye saṁvaraṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: dhammāḥ anvāssaveyyum tassa savarāya paṭipajjati rakkhati cakkhu indriya cakkhu indriye savaram āpajjati
translated: Since, if he left the eye faculty unguarded, bad, unwholesome states of longing and dejection might invade him, he practices the way of its restraint, he guards the eye faculty, he undertakes the restraint, of the eye faculty.

original: Sotena saddaṁ sutvā …pe…🔽ghānena gandhaṁ ghāyitvā …
analyzed: sotena saddam sutvā pe  ghānena gandham ghāyitvā
translated: On hearing a sound with the ear…🔽On smelling an odour with the nose…

original: jivhāya rasaṁ sāyitvā …
analyzed: jivhāya rasam sāyitvā
translated: On tasting a flavour with the tongue…

original: kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṁ phusitvā …
analyzed: kāyena phoṭṭhabbam phusitvā
translated: On touching a tangible with the body…

original: manasā dhammaṁ viññāya na nimittaggāhī hoti nānubyañjanaggāhī.
analyzed: manasā dhammam viññāya na nimitta ggāhī hoti na anubyañjana ggāhī
translated: Having known a mind with the mind, he is not one who grasps at its marks and features.

original: Yatvādhikaraṇamenaṁ manindriyaṁ asaṁvutaṁ viharantaṁ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā
analyzed: yatvā adhikaraṇam enam man indriyam viharantam abhijjhā domanassā pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ
translated: If he were to live without guarding the mind faculty, evil unwholesome states of covetousness and grief might invade him.

original: dhammā anvāssaveyyuṁ tassa saṁvarāya paṭipajjati, rakkhati manindriyaṁ, manindriye saṁvaraṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: dhammāḥ anvāssaveyyum tassa savarāya paṭipajjati rakkhati manindriya manindriye savaram āpajjati
translated: For the restraint of them he makes an effort, he guards the mind faculty, he undertakes the restraint of the mind faculty.

original: So iminā ariyena indriyasaṁvarena samannāgato ajjhattaṁ abyāsekasukhaṁ paṭisaṁvedeti.
analyzed: saḥ iminā ariyena indriya savarena samannāgataḥ ajjhattam a byāseka sukham paṭisaveda iti
translated: Endowed with this noble restraint of the faculties, he experiences within himself a bliss that is blameless.🔽He is one who acts with clear comprehension when going forward and returning;

original: So abhikkante paṭikkante sampajānakārī hoti, ālokite vilokite sampajānakārī hoti,🔽samiñjite pasārite sampajānakārī hoti, saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇe sampajānakārī hoti,
analyzed: saḥ abhikkante paṭikkante sampajāna kārī hoti ālokite vilokite sampajāna kārī hoti  samiñjite pasārite sampajānakārī hoti saṅghāṭi patta cīvara dhāraṇe sampajānakārī hoti
translated: who acts with clear comprehension when looking ahead and looking aside;🔽who acts with clear comprehension when drawing in and extending the limbs; who acts with clear comprehension when wearing his robes and carrying his outer robe and bowl;

original: asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī hoti, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī hoti,
analyzed: asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajāna kārī hoti uccāra passāva kamme sampajāna kārī hoti
translated: who acts with clear comprehension when eating, drinking, consuming food, and tasting; who acts with clear comprehension when defecating and urinating;

original: gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī hoti.
analyzed: gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajāna kārī hoti
translated: who acts with clear comprehension when walking, standing, sitting, falling asleep, waking up, talking, and keeping silent.

original: So iminā ca ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato, imāya ca ariyāya santuṭṭhiyā samannāgato
analyzed: so iminā ca ariyena sīla kkhandhena samannāgataḥ imāya ca ariyāya santuṭṭhiyā samannāgataḥ
translated: Endowed with this aggregate of noble virtue,🔽with this noble contentment,

original: iminā ca ariyena indriyasaṁvarena samannāgato, iminā ca ariyena satisampajaññena samannāgato
analyzed: iminā ca ariyena indriya savarena samannāgataḥ iminā ca ariyena sati sampajaññena samannāgataḥ
translated: with this noble restraint of the faculties, with this noble mindfulness and full awareness,

original: vivittaṁ senāsanaṁ bhajati araññaṁ rukkhamūlaṁ pabbataṁ kandaraṁ giriguhaṁ susānaṁ vanapatthaṁ abbhokāsaṁ palālapuñjaṁ.
analyzed: vivittam senāsanam bhajati araññam rukkha mūlam pabbatam kandaram giri guham su sānam vana pattham abbhokāsam palāla puñja
translated: he frequents a secluded lodging, a forest, the foot of a tree, a mountain, a ravine, a hillside cave, a charnel ground, a jungle thicket, an open space, a heap of straw.

original: So pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā, ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya, parimukhaṁ satiṁ upaṭṭhapetvā.🔽So abhijjhaṁ loke pahāya vigatābhijjhena cetasā viharati, abhijjhāya cittaṁ parisodheti.
analyzed: saḥ pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ nisīdati pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya parimukham satim upaṭṭhapetvā  saḥ abhijjham loke pahāya vigata abhijjhena cetasā viharati abhijjhāya cittam parisodheti
translated: After his meal, on his return from his alms round, he sits down, folding his legs crosswise, setting his body erect, and establishing mindfulness in front of him.🔽He, abandoning hankering for the world, dwells with a mind free from hankering; he, abandoning sorrow and dejection, dwells free from sorrow, dejected, and dispassionate.

original: Byāpādapadosaṁ pahāya abyāpannacitto viharati, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī byāpādapadosā cittaṁ parisodheti.
analyzed: byāpāda padosam pahāya a byāpanna cittaḥ viharati sabba pāṇa bhūta hita anukampī byāpāda padosā cittam parisodheti
translated: Abandoning doubt, he dwells having gone beyond doubt; he dwells with unwavering confidence in the Teacher and the Dhamma.

original: Thinamiddhaṁ pahāya vigatathinamiddho viharati ālokasaññī sato sampajāno, thinamiddhā cittaṁ parisodheti.🔽Uddhaccakukkuccaṁ pahāya anuddhato viharati, ajjhattaṁ vūpasantacitto uddhaccakukkuccā cittaṁ parisodheti.
analyzed: thinamiddham pahāya vigata thinamiddhaḥ viharati āloka saññī sataḥ sampajānaḥ thinamiddhā cittam parisodheti  uddhacca kukkuccam pahāya anuddhataḥ viharati ajjhattam vūpasanta cittaḥ uddhacca kukkuccā cittam parisodheti
translated: He abandons sloth and torpor, gets rid of sloth and torpor, and dwells in a way that is without sloth and torpor, mindful, alert, and fully aware, purifying his mind as to sloth and torpor.🔽He abandons restlessness and remorse, gets rid of restlessness and remorse, and dwells without restlessness and remorse, peacefully, calmed in mind, purifying his mind as to restlessness and remorse.

original: Vicikicchaṁ pahāya tiṇṇavicikiccho viharati akathaṅkathī kusalesu dhammesu, vicikicchāya cittaṁ parisodheti.
analyzed: vicikiccham pahāya tiṇṇa vicikicchaḥ viharati a kathaṅkathī kusalesu dhammesu vicikicchāya cittam parisodheti
translated: He abandons doubt, gets rid of doubt, and dwells with doubt left behind, without doubt, in a way that has transcended doubt, purifying his mind as to doubt.

original: So ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe,
analyzed: saḥ ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetasaḥ upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe
translated: “Having abandoned these five hindrances, defilements of the mind that weaken wisdom,

original: vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: vivicca iva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states, he enters and dwells in the first jhāna, which consists of rapture and pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by thought and examination.

original: Idampi vuccati, brāhmaṇa, tathāgatapadaṁ itipi, tathāgatanisevitaṁ itipi, tathāgatārañjitaṁ itipi.
analyzed: idam pi vuccati brāhmaṇa tathāgata padam itipi tathāgata nisevitam itipi tathāgata ārañjitam itipi
translated: This, brahmin, is said to be a track of the Tathāgata, a footprint of the Tathāgata.

original: Na tveva tāva ariyasāvako niṭṭhaṁ gacchati:
analyzed: na tu eva tāva ariya sāvakaḥ niṭṭham gacchati
translated: But the noble disciple has not yet come to the conclusion:

original: ‘sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho’ti.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammo su paṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ iti
translated: ‘The Lord is fully enlightened, the Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Lord, the Sangha is practising the good way.’

original: Puna caparaṁ, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: puna capara brāhmaṇa bhikkhu vitakka vicārānam vūpasamā ajjhattam sampasādanam cetasaḥ eka udi bhāvam a vitakkam a vicāram samādhi jam pīti sukham dutiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: “Again, with the stilling of applied and sustained thought, a bhikkhu enters upon and abides in the second jhana…

original: Idampi vuccati, brāhmaṇa …pe…
analyzed: idam pi vuccati brāhmaṇa pe
translated: This, brahmin, is called a footprint of the Tathagata…

original: suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho’ti.🔽Puna caparaṁ, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati sato ca sampajāno,🔽sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṁvedeti, yaṁ taṁ ariyā ācikkhanti ‘upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti
analyzed: su paṭipannaḥ bhagavato sāvaka saṅghaḥ iti  puna capara brāhmaṇa bhikkhu pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati sataḥ ca sampajāno  sukham ca kāyena paṭisavedeti yam tam ariyāḥ ācikkhanti upekkhakaḥ satimā sukha vihārī iti
translated: the Sangha of the Lord’s disciples is practising the good way.’🔽“Again, with the fading away as well of rapture, a bhikkhu abides in equanimity, and mindful and fully aware, still feeling pleasure with the body, he enters upon and abides in the third jhana, on account of which noble ones announce:

original: tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: tatiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: ‘He has a pleasant abiding who has equanimity and is mindful.’

original: Idampi vuccati, brāhmaṇa …pe…
analyzed: idam pi vuccati brāhmaṇa pe
translated: This, brahmin, is called a footprint of the Tathagata…

original: suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho’ti.
analyzed: su paṭipannaḥ bhagavato sāvaka saṅghaḥ iti
translated: the Sangha of the Lord’s disciples is practising the good way.’

original: Puna caparaṁ, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ
analyzed: puna capara brāhmaṇa bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbā iva somanassa domanassāna
translated: “Again, bhikkhus, with the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous passing away of joy and displeasure, a bhikkhu enters and dwells in the fourth jhana, neither painful nor pleasant, which has purification of mindfulness by equanimity.

original: atthaṅgamā, adukkhamasukhaṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: atthaṅgamā adukkham asukham upekkhā sati pārisuddhim catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: “Again, with the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous passing away of joy and displeasure, a bhikkhu enters and dwells in the fourth jhana, neither painful nor pleasant, which has purification of mindfulness by equanimity.

original: Idampi vuccati, brāhmaṇa, tathāgatapadaṁ itipi, tathāgatanisevitaṁ itipi, tathāgatārañjitaṁ itipi.
analyzed: idam pi vuccati brāhmaṇa tathāgata padam itipi tathāgata nisevitam itipi tathāgata ārañjitam itipi
translated: This too, brahmin, is called a footprint of the Tathagata…

original: Na tveva tāva ariyasāvako niṭṭhaṁ gacchati:
analyzed: na tu eva tāva ariya sāvakaḥ niṭṭham gacchati
translated: but still he has not yet come to the conclusion:

original: ‘sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho’ti.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammo su paṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ iti
translated: ‘The Blessed One is fully enlightened, the Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed One, the Sangha is practising the good way.’

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmeti.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmeti
translated: “When his concentrated mind is thus purified, bright, unblemished, rid of imperfection, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs it to knowledge of the recollection of past lives.

original: So anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ, dvepi jātiyo …pe… iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati.
analyzed: so aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati sa iyyathidam ekam pi jāti dve pi jātiyo pe iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati
translated: He recollects his manifold past lives, i.e. one birth, two five, ten fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand, many aeons of cosmic contraction, many aeons of cosmic expansion, many aeons of cosmic contraction and expansion. He remembers: ‘There I had such and such a name, belonged to such and such a clan, had such and such an appearance. Such and such was my food, such and such my sensitivity, such and such my experience of pleasure and pain, such and such the end of my life. Passing away from that state, I re-arose there. There too I had such and such a name, belonged to such and such a clan, had such and such an appearance. Such and such was my food, such and such my sensitivity, such and such my experience of pleasure and pain, such and such the end of my life. Passing away from that state, I re-arose here.’ Thus he remembers his manifold past lives in their modes and details.

original: Idampi vuccati, brāhmaṇa, tathāgatapadaṁ itipi, tathāgatanisevitaṁ itipi, tathāgatārañjitaṁ itipi.
analyzed: idam pi vuccati brāhmaṇa tathāgata padam itipi tathāgata nisevitam itipi tathāgata ārañjitam itipi
translated: This, brahmin, is said to be a footprint of the Tathagata …

original: Na tveva tāva ariyasāvako niṭṭhaṁ gacchati:
analyzed: na tu eva tāva ariya sāvakaḥ niṭṭham gacchati
translated: but the noble disciple has not yet come to the conclusion:

original: ‘sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho’ti.🔽So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte sattānaṁ cutūpapātañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmeti.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammo su paṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ iti  saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte sattānam cutūpapāta ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmeti
translated: ‘The Blessed Lord is fully enlightened, the Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed Lord, the Sangha is practising the good way.’🔽When his concentrated mind is thus purified, bright, unblemished, rid of imperfection, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs it to knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings.

original: So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena …pe… yathākammūpage satte pajānāti.
analyzed: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena pe yathā kamma upage satte pajānāti
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate. He understands how beings pass on according to their actions thus:

original: Idampi vuccati, brāhmaṇa, tathāgatapadaṁ itipi, tathāgatanisevitaṁ itipi, tathāgatārañjitaṁ itipi.
analyzed: idam pi vuccati brāhmaṇa tathāgata padam itipi tathāgata nisevitam itipi tathāgata ārañjitam itipi
translated: This, brahmin, is said to be a Tathagata’s expression, a Tathagata’s description, of a Tathagata.

original: Na tveva tāva ariyasāvako niṭṭhaṁ gacchati:
analyzed: na tu eva tāva ariya sāvakaḥ niṭṭham gacchati
translated: But still a noble disciple has not yet reached a conclusion:

original: ‘sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho’ti.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammo su paṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ iti
translated: ‘The Blessed Lord is fully enlightened, the Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Blessed Lord, the Sangha is practising the good way.’

original: So evaṁ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte āsavānaṁ khayañāṇāya cittaṁ abhininnāmeti.
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñja ppatte āsavānam khaya ñāṇāya cittam abhininnāmeti
translated: When his mind is thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilement, pliant, malleable, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs it to knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: So ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti,
analyzed: saḥ idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: He knows as it really is: ‘This is suffering’; he knows as it really is: ‘This is the origin of suffering’;

original: ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti🔽yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: ayam dukkha nirodho ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati  yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: he knows as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of suffering’; he knows as it really is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’

original: ‘Ime āsavā’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ āsavasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti,
analyzed: ime āsavāḥ ti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam āsava samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: He knows as it really is: ‘These are the taints’; he knows as it really is: ‘This is the origin of the taints’;

original: ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, ‘ayaṁ āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti
analyzed: ayam āsava nirodha uti yathābhūtam pajānāti ayam āsava nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati
translated: He understands as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of the effluents.’

original: yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti.
analyzed: yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: He understands as it really is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of the effluents.’

original: Idampi vuccati, brāhmaṇa, tathāgatapadaṁ itipi, tathāgatanisevitaṁ itipi, tathāgatārañjitaṁ itipi.
analyzed: idam pi vuccati brāhmaṇa tathāgata padam itipi tathāgata nisevitam itipi tathāgata ārañjitam itipi
translated: This, brahman, is said to be a phrase that the Tathagata has not uttered, that the Tathagata has not looked into, that the Tathagata has not been fully awakened to.

original: Na tveva tāva ariyasāvako niṭṭhaṁ gato hoti, api ca kho niṭṭhaṁ gacchati:
analyzed: na tu eva tāva ariya sāvako niṭṭham gataḥ hoti api ca kho niṭṭham gacchati
translated: But a disciple of the noble ones is not yet fully satisfied with that. He thinks:

original: ‘sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho’ti.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammo su paṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ iti
translated: ‘The Blessed One is fully enlightened, the Dhamma is well-proclaimed by the Blessed One, the Sangha is practicing the good way.’

original: Tassa evaṁ jānato evaṁ passato kāmāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati, bhavāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati, avijjāsavāpi cittaṁ vimuccati.
analyzed: tassa evam jānataḥ evam passataḥ kāma āsavā api cittam vimuccati bhava āsavā api cittam vimuccati avijjā āsavā api cittam vimuccati
translated: When he knows and sees thus, his mind is liberated from the effluent of sensuality, from the effluent of becoming, and from the effluent of ignorance.

original: Vimuttasmiṁ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṁ hoti.
analyzed: vimuttasmin vimuttam iti ñāṇam hoti
translated: When it is liberated there comes the knowledge: ‘It’s liberated.’

original: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati pajānāti
translated: He understands: ‘Birth is destroyed, the holy life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no more coming to any state of being.’

original: Idampi vuccati, brāhmaṇa, tathāgatapadaṁ itipi, tathāgatanisevitaṁ itipi, tathāgatārañjitaṁ itipi.
analyzed: idam pi vuccati brāhmaṇa tathāgata padam itipi tathāgata nisevitam itipi tathāgata ārañjitam itipi
translated: This, brahmin, is said to be a Tathagata’s expression, a Tathagata’s description, of a Tathagata.

original: Ettāvatā kho, brāhmaṇa, ariyasāvako niṭṭhaṁ gato hoti:🔽‘sammāsambuddho bhagavā, svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho’ti.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho brāhmaṇa ariya sāvakaḥ niṭṭham gataḥ hoti  sammāsambuddhaḥ bhagavā su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammo su paṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ iti
translated: To this extent, brahmin, a noble disciple is said to have arrived at this safe haven,🔽to have arrived at this supreme security from bondage,

original: Ettāvatā kho, brāhmaṇa, hatthipadopamo vitthārena paripūro hotī”ti.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho brāhmaṇa hatthi pada upamaḥ vitthārena paripūraḥ hoti iti
translated: to this extent the simile of the elephant’s footprint has been fulfilled in detail.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the brahmin Janussoni said to the Blessed One:

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.🔽Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama  seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent, Master Gotama!

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Master Gotama has made the Dhamma clear in many ways, as though he were turning upright what had been overthrown, revealing what was hidden, showing the way to one who is lost, or holding up a lamp in the dark for those with eyesight to see forms.

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: So too, Master Gotama has revealed the Dhamma in many ways.

original: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi, dhammañca, bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the Dhamma, and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: Let Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

original: Cūḷahatthipadopamasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: cūḷahatthipadopama suttam niṭṭhitam sattama
translated: The Shorter Discourse on the Simile of the Elephant’s Footprint is finished.
